docs.lead_paragraph: An American who arrived as a volunteer rescue worker after the 2005 earthquake that killed 80,000 Pakistanis started a hospital that treats 100,000 annually.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers failed at their first attempt as a body to close the state’s multibillion-dollar shortfall, signaling that California is slipping deeper into financial crisis.

docs.lead_paragraph: I wrote my Thursday column about the A.M.A. and health care partly because I think that the A.M.A. takes advantage of our general trust for doctors to lobby for policy positions -- such as opposition to a public insurance option -- that are inimical to the public's health. Secondly, I think that while the public option isn't a solution by itself, any successful effort to kill it would be deadly to broader efforts to reform health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday we published ideas from experts and stakeholders about what the priorities should be for reforming America's health care system. Here are links to all of them, since they were scattered among several blog entries.
docs.abstract: On Tuesday, we ran a series of posts from experts and stakeholders about what the priorities should be for reforming America's health care system. Here are links to all of them.

docs.lead_paragraph: With health care reform at the top of the agenda on Capitol Hill and at the White House, the public campaigns for and against a public insurance option are beginning to shift into high gear. And so far, the message is Democrats beware, because they have become the prime targets, not only of the opposition but from within their own ranks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health care legislation reassumes its premier spot on the agendas of both the Obama administration and lawmakers on Capitol Hill, while climate and energy issues also hold quite a bit of attention.

docs.lead_paragraph: As President Obama’s effort to overhaul health care seems to hit one roadblock after another in Congress, he is counting on Senator Max Baucus for help.
